snippet: Hundreds of people are dying in military detention from shootings, suffocation or starvation as Nigeria’s security forces crack down on an Islamic uprising in the northeast, Amnesty International said Tuesday.
abstract: Amnesty International reports that over 950 people have died in Nigerian prisons in 2013, from shootings, suffocation or starvation, as security forces crack down on Islamic uprising in northeast; if number is accurate, Nigeria’s military has killed more civilians than militants have during first half of 2013
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of people are dying in military detention from shootings, suffocation or starvation as Nigeria’s security forces crack down on an Islamic uprising in the northeast, Amnesty International said Tuesday.

headline.main: Nigeria: Hundreds Die in Custody During Crackdown, Rights Group Says
headline.print_headline: Nigeria: Hundreds Die in Custody During Crackdown, Rights Group Says
